ray.renderer

Class LuminairesIlluminator

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.renderer.DirectIlluminator
      • ray.renderer.LuminairesIlluminator

  • public class LuminairesIlluminator
extends DirectIlluminator
    This class computes direct illumination by integrating over the area of the luminaires. It calls the scene to generate a random point on a luminaire, and it uses the pdf (wrt. area) returned by the luminaire sampling code together with the area integration formulation of local illumination.
    Author:
    cxz (at Columbia)

    • Method Detail

      • directIllumination

        public void directIllumination(Scene scene,
                               Vector3 incDir,
                               Vector3 outDir,
                               IntersectionRecord iRec,
                               Point2 seed,
                               Color outColor)
        Computes radiance due to direct reflection and writes it to outColor. 1. Get Illuminaires in the current scene 2. Randomly select a Illuminaires according to their areas 3. Randomly select a point from that Illuminaire
        Specified by:
        directIllumination in class DirectIlluminator
        Parameters:
        scene - the scene to be rendered
        outDir - the exitant direction (canonical coordinates)
        iRec - information about the shading point
        seed - stratified random point
        outColor - reflected radiance is written to this color
